newsitem.title: HONG KONG: HK govt to end consideration on dealing levy in 97.
newsitem.headline: HK govt to end consideration on dealing levy in 97.

text.p: The Hong Kong government expected to conclude in 1997 its consideration of a stock transaction levy cut, Financial Services Secretary Rafael Hui said on Friday.
"We are considering the issue of transaction levy. It is related to the overall transaction costs. This should be concluded in 1997," Hui told reporters.
"As to whether we'll consider (an adjustment in) stamp duty or even brokerage commission at the same time then, I hope to be able to do so," he said.
Hong Kong transaction costs include a governemnt stamp duty, brokerage commisions, transaction levies and clearing fees.
"We are waiting for views from the Stock Exchange and the Securities and Futures Commission (SFC) on how to cut transaction levy," Hui said.
"I know their (the Stock Exchange's and the SFC's) recommendation may involve stamp duty and commission as well. We will be able to consider them together then," he said.
In March, Hong Kong Financial Secretary Donald Tsang said in his budget speech he was prepared to review the stamp duty rate on stock transactions.
